intro: Corydalis remota f. heteroclita, commonly known as the remote corydalis, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It is native to the mountainous regions of China and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
